title: Has Lloyds Run Too Far After Surging 66% in 2025?
summary: Curious if Lloyds Banking Group is trading at a bargain or just keeping up with the crowd? Let’s dig into where the value case stands right now. Lloyds’ stock has soared 66.2% year-to-date and is up an eye-catching 209.9% over five years, with a recent 11.0% jump in just the last month. Much of this momentum has come on the heels of a renewed confidence in UK banking stocks, with positive market sentiment following regulatory updates and shifts in interest rate expectations, sparking fresh...

title: Lloyds clinches £120m deal for digital wallet provider Curve
summary: Britain's biggest high street lender has struck a £120m deal to buy Curve, the digital wallet provider, despite recriminations from shareholders about the distribution of the sale proceeds.  Sky News has learnt Curve notified its investors this week that it had signed a share sale and purchase agreement with Lloyds Banking Group.

title: FTSE 100 down and US markets mixed amid UK budget rumours and doubts about Fed rate cut
summary: The tepid trade in the US followed Wall Street's steepest sell-off in over a month as ebbing faith in a December interest-rate cut puts pressure on riskier assets like Big Techs.

title: Octopus COPs £500m financing boost for electric vehicles arm
summary: The electric vehicle-leasing business which forms part of the same group as Britain's biggest household energy supplier will on Friday announce a £500m extension to its financing war chest.  Sky News has learnt that Octopus Electric Vehicles (Octopus EV) has struck a deal with lenders including Lloyds Banking Group, Morgan Stanley, and Credit Agricole to take its total funding line to £2bn.  The additional financing paves the way for the expansion of the company's UK fleet from 40,000 to 75,000 cars, and is an extension to a facility agreed with Lloyds in 2023.
